Class Board

java.lang.Object
application.model.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the 10×20 Tetris playing field.

This is the core model class with no JavaFX dependencies, fully unit-testable with JUnit 5.

Responsibilities:

  • Manages the grid of Cell objects.
  • Collision detection for piece placement and movement.
  • Locking a Tetromino into the grid.
  • Line clearing logic (returns number of lines cleared for damage calculation).
  • Trash line insertion (boss attacks push rows up from the bottom).
  • Game-over detection (any occupied cell in the top hidden rows).

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Creates a new empty board with the default dimensions from Config.

    • Board

      public Board(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a new empty board with the specified dimensions.
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows (height)
      cols - number of columns (width)

  • Method Details

    • canPlace

      public boolean canPlace(int[][] shape, int row, int col)
      Checks whether the given tetromino can be placed at the specified position without colliding with existing blocks or going out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      shape - the 2D shape matrix of the tetromino (1 = filled)
      row - the top-left row of the piece on the board
      col - the top-left column of the piece on the board
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid (no collision), false otherwise

    • canPlace

      public boolean canPlace(Tetromino tetromino)
      Checks if the given tetromino can be placed at its current position.
      Parameters:
      tetromino - the tetromino to check
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid

    • lockPiece

      public void lockPiece(Tetromino tetromino)
      Locks the given tetromino into the grid at its current position. After locking, the cells occupied by the tetromino become permanently filled.
      Parameters:
      tetromino - the tetromino to lock

    • clearFullLines

      public int clearFullLines()
      Checks for and clears any fully completed lines. Cleared lines are removed and empty rows are added at the top.
      Returns:
      the number of lines cleared (used to calculate boss damage)

    • addTrashLines

      public void addTrashLines(int count)
      Inserts the specified number of trash lines at the bottom of the board. Each trash line is fully occupied except for one random gap column. All existing rows are pushed upward. If this causes blocks to overflow the top, the game-over check will catch it.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of trash lines to insert

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over. The game is over if any cell in the top two rows (rows 0–1) is occupied, indicating the board has overflowed.
      Returns:
      true if the board is in a game-over state

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int row, int col)
      Returns the cell at the given position. The returned reference is the actual cell in the grid (not a copy) for rendering efficiency.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index (0 = top)
      col - the column index (0 = left)
      Returns:
      the Cell at (row, col)
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if row or col is out of bounds

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows in the board.

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Returns the number of columns in the board.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Clears the entire board, resetting all cells to empty.

    • setCellState

      public void setCellState(int row, int col, boolean occupied, String colorName)
      Sets a specific cell's state. Useful for unit testing scenarios.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      col - the column index
      occupied - whether the cell should be occupied
      colorName - the color name (null if empty)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
